title: Hippo ivory to be banned as Government set to close 'loophole' in poaching laws
text:
Hippo ivory will be banned under plans being drawn up by ministers to close a loophole in poaching laws, the Sunday Telegraph has learned.

The Ivory Act prohibits the sale of elephant ivory but allows hunters to trade the tusks and skulls of hippos. Hippos are more endangered than elephants with 400,000 elephants left in the wild, it is thought there are just 130,000 hippos.

Previous reporting by this newspaper has found that antique dealers have been readying to replace elephant ivory with hippo ivory when restoring old furniture.
